Assuming you are on a Linux/UNIX:

If you change the 'umask' defaults for the user who launches the 
Heritrix/java process, before that process is launched, it should change 
how it creates files. See for more info:

http://www.dartmouth.edu/~rc/help/faq/permissions.html
http://www.psc.edu/general/unix/umask.php

On other OSes, there may be something similar. Heritrix is making no 
explicit choices in this matter; it is generally oblivious to OS file 
permissions, simply performing all file reads/creates/writes as the user 
it runs as.

- Gordon @ IA
